DOC.detailed_description: In current clinical practice malnourish ( undernourished ) patient may receive oral nutritional supplement ( ONS ) aid management malnutrition ( undernutrition ) . Poor compliance ONS report scientific literature , however recent study low volume , high energy ONS show high compliance . This study aim explore compliance low volume ONS compare standard ONS . This study 2 week cross study 4 week optional extension . Participants risk malnutrition receive low volume , high energy ONS 1 week standard ONS 1 week random order compare nutrient intake compliance . This short term element study design base similar study Hubbard et al 2009 , significant difference compliance energy intake observe . Participants may take part optional 4 week extension period receive prefer ONS 4 week . Longer term outcome change weight , muscle function tolerance ONS measure part study . Changes weight muscle function typically see 4 week . Overview study : 1 . Participants assess inclusion exclusion criterion investigate dietitian research nurse , provide information study . Eligible participant ask write informed consent . Participant characteristic medical history collect . 2 . Participants randomly allocate receive either : A . A standard ONS ( 1.5kcal/ml ) control , ad libitum addition diet 7 day . Participants receive high energy , low volume equivalent ONS ( 2.4kcal/ml ) ad libitum addition diet 7 day ( n=70 ) , : B . A high energy , low volume ONS ( 2.4kcal/ml ) ad libitum addition diet 7 day . Participants receive equivalent standard ONS ( 1.5kcal/ml ) control , ad libitum addition diet 7 day ( n=70 ) . Participants option continue preferred ONS 4 week ( 28 day ) .
